intro: Trichilia laurentii, commonly known as African snowball, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. It produces fragrant white or yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
